questions.question_text:
You manage the Dynamics 365 for Customer Service environment for an organization.
Microsoft SharePoint will not be deployed in the environment for a year.
You need to integrate Microsoft Office 365 solutions with the Dynamics 365 instance to help the sales team with internal collaboration efforts.
Which three solutions can you currently implement? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: To integrate OneDrive and OneNote on CRM Sharepoint is needed so it's right

comments.content: Correct answer and can be easily seen by picture provided in the ref link

discussion.content: this Q in PL-200

Actually not, Exchange Online allows users to use OnDrive, But OneDrive is not a Office 365 Solution, is more like a feature included in an Office Solution such as Sharepoint and Exchange. But yes, the answer is correct.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/basics/use-onedrive-business-manage-private-documents

comments.content: CORRECT just missing Share point on line : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/add-office-365-online-services
wtf dude... read the question! The answer is totally correct!
Not correct... the back-end of OneDrive IS SharePoint

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are a Microsoft Dynamics 365 administrator for Contoso, Ltd. A user named Elizabeth Rice signs in to Dynamics 365 by using the following sign in name:
Elisabeth.Rice@contoso.com.
After marriage, Elisabeth changes her legal name to Elisabeth Mueller.
You need to update the sign in name for the user without losing any application history.
Solution: From Dynamics 365, select Email Configuration. In the active mailbox for the user, update the name.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: B is correct answer. If sign in name needs to be updated it should be done from admin portal.
This Q came at PL-200
No is correct
No is Correct
"No" is correct.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service system administrator. You use the Data Performance tool. There are 14 items in the All Data Performance Logs view. Some log items detail positive operational impact percentages while others detail negative operational percentages.
Users report that the system is less responsive than in the past.
You need to improve system performance.
Solution: Select optimize for log items that have optimizations available and that have a positive operational impact percentage.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
The answer is right

Negative values indicate an improvement in query performance and positive values reveal that the optimization is actually degrading performance

comments.content: No. Correct Answer is B.No
So answer A.

discussion.content:
The answer is correct. Let's have a closer look at the question:
"..There are 14 items in the All Data Performance Logs view. Some log items detail positive operational impact percentages while others detail negative operational percentages."

Since it is mentioned that the user is able to see the positive and negative operational percentages. That implies that the OPTIMIZE has already been clicked for some of the queries earlier.
Now read this "Initially after a query is optimized using the OPTIMIZE command bar button the column will show no value, but over time after the optimized query is run, this column will show negative or positive integer values. Negative values indicate an improvement in query performance and positive values reveal that the optimization is actually degrading performance. If that is the case, the optimization can be removed using the REMOVE OPTIMIZATION command bar button."

https://powerobjects.com/2017/10/30/managing-your-data-performance-in-dynamics-365/

Read the following sentence " Initially after a query is optimized using the OPTIMIZE command bar button the column will show no value, but over time after the optimized query is run, this column will show negative or positive integer values. Negative values indicate an improvement in query performance and positive values reveal that the optimization is actually degrading performance" which suggests selecting the negative items and clicking optimizing will improve the performance, selecting positive values will degrade it. so the correct answer is "No".
which is correct answer?

Actually, A is the right answer though it does seem counterintuitive.
According to https://powerobjects.com/2017/10/30/managing-your-data-performance-in-dynamics-365/:
Initially after a query is optimized using the OPTIMIZE command bar button the column will show no value, but over time after the optimized query is run, this column will show negative or positive integer values. Negative values indicate an improvement in query performance and positive values reveal that the optimization is actually degrading performance. If that is the case, the optimization can be removed using the REMOVE OPTIMIZATION command bar button.
In my exam
B- if the value is positive you should remove it and not optimize.

B is a correct answer : 
Optimization Impact. All potential optimizations begin with an optimization impact value of 0. Potential optimizations have no impact measurement yet because the optimization hasn't been applied. Over time, after an optimization is applied by clicking OPTIMIZE, an integer value is displayed that represents query performance impact. For example, after one week since the optimization was applied, the value that appears can help indicate whether an optimization has improved or degraded query performance for the given entity. A negative value suggests an improvement in query performance, whereas a positive number suggests a degradation in query performance. So, an optimization applied one week ago that has a value of -10% suggests a 10 percent improvement in query performance.
ref : https://portal.dynamics365support.com/knowledgebase/article/KA-01217/en-us
Hi Gavin - yes - this feature appears to have been removed in V9 orgs.

This question is no longer relevant as Data Performance Tool does not exist anymore in Dynamics 365 CE v9 (it was only available in v8). Apparently the question has been challenged but it's useful to know the correct answer in case this question hasn't been pulled yet and could make a difference to marginal exam scores!

If you see any value, positive or negative, that means you have already optimized the item. If the value is positive, it is better to remove optimization.

So the answer seems right.
Is this question complete? Or after select there are some actions missing, such as stop them or delete them? Cannot really understand the logic, what selection can impact the system?
this doesn't make sense.. positive impact (yes) should be the answer

comments.content:
"Initially after a query is optimized using the OPTIMIZE command bar button the column will show no value, but over time after the optimized query is run, this column will show negative or positive integer values."
So 'No ' is the valid answer since you have to optimize first before it shows values.

choices.A: Sign in to the Sandbox instance. Create the solution with Voice of the Customer entities, test Voice of the Customer, and then import the solution into the production instance.
choices.B: Select the Application tab in the Dynamics 365 admin center. Configure Voice of the Customer.
choices.E: Add the correct role to each user to allow them to use the Voice of the Customer solution.
choices.D: Search AppSource for Voice of the Customer. Import the solution.
choices.C: Download Voice of the Customer from the Microsoft website. Import the solution into the Dynamics 365 instance.

discussion.content: In exam question
correct

questions.question_text:
You manage a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service instance.
You need to add Voice of the Customer to the instance.
What should you do?

DRAG DROP -
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service system administrator. You create a workflow that requires customizations to automate lead follow-up activities.
You need to migrate the production customizations to this new Dynamics 365 production instance. You must not migrate any data to the production instance.
Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:

discussion.content:
- In D365 admin center, select instance tab.
- Select the production instance and click copy.
- Select target instance. 
- Select minimal copy.
- In the copy instance page, select copy.

comments.content: perfect (Y)
Not Quite. You cannot copy to a Production Instance, so a step is missing here to change it to Sandbox. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/admin/copy-instance
Your right. There is a separate question that is similar which mandates switching to Sandbox thought that might apply here.

you are right, but this is not what is asked and also when taking in consideration what what steps are available as an answer.^^

The scenario is that you do the copy to a NEW instance, I agree that the necessary step switching to sandbox, copy it and switch it to production is missing - but as there is no step available for selecting "switch to sandbox" / "Switch to production".

You can only select a Target instance that as the typ "Sandbox". But as this step is not available I agree on the solution from the top post.

Thanks for this, it seems as if everyone agrees this is correct. It looks correct. I don't know what other options were presented as the image or full list appears to be missing, but this sure looks like it would be the right 5 choices (assuming as others have mentioned that changing the production instance to a sandbox is not in the options) and in the right order.

In D365 admin center, select instance tab.
- Select the production instance and click copy.
- Select minimal copy.
- Select target instance.
- In the copy instance page, select copy.
That's the correct answer. Checked on admin powerplatform
The question is asking about copying from Production not to.
Production needs to be converted to sandbox first. you cannot copy to a production instance.
I think that the last must be "Minimal Copy', since we are asked NOT to migrate any data
That's an understatement. And why are they developing in a production instance to begin with?

I hear you, but after re-reading "You need to migrate the production customizations to this new Dynamics 365 production instance"... I think what they mean is you're moving 'production customizations' from a sandbox to production. It is just worded terribly, as usual. Microsoft exams are very poorly written.

discussion.content: This might be the correct answer, but it's a crazy way to move a workflow.

Options - https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RnmigPoV4PY4ppmArS9Tsn9sjDS8ZiLi/view?usp=sharing
Answer: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kTl0wnzTfq5Q6yLheu54Y02NpUwhnUeK/view?usp=sharing

Answer options : 

1 - Select the Production instance and select Backup & Restore
2 - In Dynamics 365 admin center, select the Instance tab
3 - In the Copy Instance page, select Copy
4 - Select Full Copy
5 - Select the Production instance and click Copy
6 - Select Minimal Copy
7 - Select the Target instance

CORRECT ANSWER :

1 - In Dynamics 365 admin center, select the Instance tab
2 - Select the Production instance and click Copy
3 - Select the Target instance
5 - Select Minimal Copy
6 - In the Copy Instance page, select Copy
What are the options available for this question?
